page.title: 07HAYES FARM
page.content: Hayes Secondary pupils visited Hayes Farm. They saw these vegetables: lettuce; onions; potatoes; runner beans; cabbages; carrots; broad beans; peas; cauliflowers; brussel sprouts. Soft fruits: strawberries; raspberries; blackcurrants; gooseberries; apples; rhubarb. Cereals:barley The Farm Shop opened in 1962. Many people come to pick their own fruit. The reservoir in Hayes Farm is about the size of 1 1/2 football pitches. It contains 4 million gallons of water. The Farmer built the reservoir because he thought that if there was a drought he would have enough water for the crops. The fish in the reservoir are brown and rainbow trout and a pike which is not meant to be there. You can only fish with a permit.
